title: Sexuality & Intimacy
subtitle: Beyond performance into presence
description: Explore sexuality as a path of connection rather than performance. This course covers healing sexual shame, understanding desire, building genuine intimacy, and bringing presence to erotic experience.

questions.question: How does sexual shame typically form?
options: Through messages received about sexuality being dirty, wrong, or shameful

questions.question: What is the difference between spontaneous and responsive desire?
options: Spontaneous arises without context; responsive emerges in response to stimulation or connection

questions.question: What does 'presence' mean in sexuality?
options: Full embodied awareness of sensation, connection, and the present moment

questions.question: Why is performance orientation problematic in sexuality?
options: It creates anxiety, disconnection from sensation, and focus on outcome over experience

questions.question: What makes sexual communication effective?
options: Direct, specific, shame-free expression of desires and boundaries

questions.question: How does intimacy deepen over time?
options: Through continued vulnerability, presence, exploration, and prioritization
